title: Which of the following most accurately describe...

content.prompt: Which of the following most accurately describes the attitude of the Founding Fathers toward political parties?

choices.label: Parties are vehicles of ambition and selfish interest that threaten the existence of republican government.
Parties are engines of democracy that provide citizens with a voice in government.
Parties are necessary evils in any republic.
In a large republic, parties are the best means of creating effective coalitions of interest groups.
A two-party system is essential to a stable republic.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
